column3: str
Staelwyrn worries his burlap sack of oranges will not reach the La Thagran Checkpoint as planned.

Sevrin has made off with a burlap sack of oranges with the intention of fencing it to goblins. Staelwyrn bids you seek out Sevrin and cast /doubt on his actions, that he might be compelled to return the oranges.
Sure enough, Sevrin attempted to hock Staelwyrn's oranges to goblins. When the deal went sour, Sevrin got away, but his three henchmen are still in need of rescue.
Inform Sevrin that his henchmen are alive and well, and talk to him about the burlap sack of oranges.
Sevrin is grateful to you for saving his henchmen, and pledges to honor his word. Retrieve the sack of oranges.
Deliver the sack to its rightful recipient, Ossine at the La Thagran Checkpoint.
Judging by Ossine's reaction, this is not the first time Sevrin has attempted a stunt like this. Return to Summerford Farms and relay to Staelwyrn all that transpired.
Staelwyrn bemoans the fact that Sevrin is more trouble than he will ever be worth. Good help is hard to find.
Confront Sevrin and cast /doubt on his actions.
Save Sevrin's henchmen.
Speak with Sevrin.
Retrieve the burlap sack of oranges.
Deliver the burlap sack of oranges to Ossine at the La Thagran Checkpoint.
Report to Staelwyrn.
All the gil in the world can't buy loyalty. Some, like you, can be trusted─others not. 'Tis that simple.
Until now, I've had no choice but to rely on that charlatan Sevrin, even though he's been doin' shady deals behind my back─fencing our oranges to goblins, for one.

Not a bell ago, a burlap sack of oranges vanished, as did Sevrin. The bastard's at it again, I'm certain of it. I want you to find and confront Sevrin for me, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. He's bound to any wrong doin', though, so you'll have to <Color(-34022)>doubt</Color> him in no uncertain terms.
Bloody hells! I'm up the Strait of Merlthor without a paddle now!
Staelwyrn sent you for the oranges, did he? So the old bugger had known all this time... Argh, what does it matter now anyway?
Hear me out! I need you to rescue me mates from those double-dealin' goblins! They're down by the bonfire.
You save me mates and by the Navigator, you'll have your sack of scurvy snacks!
I owe you one. Would've gotten away meself if not fer Sevrin shovin' me aside.
Sevrin sent you? Ha! The way he high-tailed it out of there, I was sure he'd sold us down the river!
Textless
If you hadn't come my goose would've been cooked! Mmm...cooked goose.
You saved me mates, and for that, I owe you.
S'pose I should be ashamed I couldn't clean up my own mess...
...But a pirate knows no shame! I've no qualms about goin' back on my word! I'm only givin' you this sack because I like the cut of your jib. Take it to Ossine, an' send her my regards.
What have we here? A delivery from Summerford Farms as scheduled? Hah! There's a first time for everything!
And what's more, not a single one missing! The only thing missing are those bootlegging bagmen, and I don't miss them one bit.
Here's Staelwyrn's payment in full. With you, I can trust it'll reach him!
Textless
Back in one piece! That's a relief.
And with all the money I'm owed, no less. Alas, I'd held out hope I'd be wrong about Sevrin.
And I might've even been willin' to overlook his skimmin' off the top, if it hadn't been to godsforsaken goblins!
You keep an eye on that two-gil shyster. If he'd leave his crew to the crows, there's no tellin' what he'll do to you!
Textless
You sense a hostile presence!
